StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: CIDR: Impact of Genetic Variants on Failure of Active Surveillance for Prostate Cancer

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This research was funded by a National Institutes of Health Prostate SPORE Grant (P50CA180995), a Center for Inherited Disease Research Grant (X01 HG009642-01), as well as by generous philanthropic funds from the Urological Research Foundation NorthShore University HealthSystem. Samples for this project were provided by the following institutions: the University of California Davis, the University of California San Francisco, the University of California Los Angles, Northwestern University, the University of Alabama, the University of Pittsburgh, the University of British Columbia, Emory University, Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, Weill Cornell Medical Center, Vanderbilt University, Cleveland Clinic, New York University, the University of Oklahoma, Mayo Clinic, Indiana University, NorthShore University HealthSystem, Johns Hopkins University, the Urological Research Network, the Royal Melbourne Hospital, Oregon Health and Sciences University, Sunnybrook Research Institute, the University Health Network, the University of Chicago, the University of Michigan, Erasmus University, and the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Prostate Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PC-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Prostate Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-CA-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Prostate Cancer, IRB, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PC-IRB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Prostate Cancer. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Prostate Cancer, PUB, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PC-PUB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Prostate Cancer. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Prostate Cancer, PUB, NPU, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PC-PUB-NPU-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Prostate Cancer. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Prostate Cancer)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PC
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Prostate Cancer.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
